detailed_profile.name: Matthias Medert
detailed_profile.position: Global Head of Sustainability at SAP ‚ú™ Leading Sustainable Practices ‚ú™ Committed to Environmental Stewardship, Human Rights & AI Ethics ‚ú™ Driving Positive Change for Society & Planet ‚ú™ Innovating for a Sustainable Future
detailed_profile.about: I am a passionate advocate for environmental stewardship, human rights, and ethical AI. As the Global Head of Sustainability at SAP, I focus on integrating sustainable practices throughout our operations and value chain, ensuring our commitment to mitigating sustainability risks, enhancing reputation and trust, and driving sustainable growth and returns. My Goal My goal is to solidify SAP's position as an exemplar in sustainable practices by prioritizing environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors. I aim to propel our sustainability agenda forward, creating value for our customers, employees, and society. Why Connecting? üî≤ For Customers Empowering with Real-Life Experience: If you are interested in SAP's sustainability solutions, I am here to share how SAP leverages our ERP-centric, cloud-based, AI-enabled products to achieve our sustainability objectives. Consider me a reference for understanding the practical application of these solutions. üî≤ For Fellow Chief Sustainability Officers Exchange of Best Practices: Collaboration is key to driving impactful outcomes. I am keen to connect with other sustainability leaders to share insights, strategies, and innovations. Together, we can create solutions and influence standards to drive positive change within and across industries and geographies. üî≤ For SAP Employees Follow me to receive regular updates on SAP's sustainability initiatives. By staying informed and engaged, we can collectively embed sustainability into our corporate culture, ensuring SAP continues to lead in sustainable practices and governance. My Current Focus Areas: #) Environment: Committing to achieving NetZero by 2030 and improving the environmental impact of our operations. #) Social: Ensuring compliance with the German Supply Chain Act (LkSG) and other mandatory human rights due diligence legislation. #) AI Ethics: Governing AI ethics at SAP with the highest standards and governance processes. My Commitment I am dedicated to driving positive change by fostering a sustainable future that benefits our company, society, and the planet. By prioritizing environmental stewardship, human rights, and AI ethics, we can inspire each other and make sustainability the cornerstone of our legacy.

recommendations: Alexandre ROS ‚ÄúI have had the pleasure of working in Matthias' organization for the past six years. Throughout our interactions, his leadership, strategic thinking and people management skills were key to meet the ever-transforming expectations of SAP and our customers. Two aspects of his leadership come to mind: First, his mastery of strengthening ties with customers in times of turmoil to successfully support their data-driven digital transformation. Second, his capacity to listen to his people and bridge the gap between their expectations and the organization's needs. Underlying both aspects is his knowledgeable vow to improve sustainable business, one step at a time, by rethinking processes without neglecting his goals and direct reports. Both a servant and strategic leader through and through.‚Äù

LinkedIn User ‚ÄúFrom my point of view, Matthias is an absolute leader when it comes to inspiring young people to take on a sustainable way of living and spreading ways of how to do so. I was very fortunate to meet Matthias during my last semester in university. The class was about building a digital, social enterprise, together with the support of mentors from SAP. After pitching our business, a digital procurement platform for ‚ÄúUnverpackt‚Äù (zero waste) stores, we found a perfect match with our mentor Matthias. With his help and expert guidance on the topic of sustainability, we managed to set the conceptual foundation of our venture and also were able to pitch our business to an expert jury ‚Äì landing first place in the competition. Without Matthias, this would not have been possible. Beyond this class, Matthias continued to mentor me in my professional life, which I am very thankful for. I would 100% recommend to everybody who gets the chance to work for Matthias, since he is a great role model and leader.‚Äù

publications.description: This book discusses the 17 Sustainable Development Goals and was published by a leading global scientific publisher.Content: The book outlines a vision for a desirable future based on the 17 UN Sustainable Development Goals. You will learn, briefly and clearly, the specific backgrounds, interconnections, and challenges of each goal that still need to be overcome on the way.The book is aimed at people who care about environmental destruction and the suffering of others. It makes these topics tangible and shows ways in which you can contribute to a world where you and your children would want to live.If one day my children ask me, 'What did you do when you realized that you were living unsustainably ‚Äî at our expense?' I would like to have an answer that I am proud of.

detailed_profile.name: Jose Valles
recommendations: Grant Coleman ‚ÄúJose is one of most natural born people leaders I have ever had the opportunity to watch at work. We were peers running different regions at SAP, and I saw Jose drive a complete 180 degree pivot of the regions performance to become the highest growing region inside just 6 months. But, the important things come when you understand why Jose is able to drive these outcomes. He was firstly able to find the right strategic approach to unlock potential in the business, but secondly (and this is where the real secret sauce is for me), he was able to communicate and drive these strategies better than anyone I have ever seen. When Jose tells you how why, when and with who, you absolutely believe it can be done and will be achieved. He can break through multiple personalities using humour and credibility to earn the trust of his teams and audiences. He is never focused on just how Sales and Success are going to get it done, rather, he understands the value in galvanising all teams and departments to march toward the same goal - a huge benefit of his very varied and multi departmental experience. One of the very best, I am sure I will work for him one day!‚Äù

LinkedIn User ‚ÄúJose joined the EMEA business at a critical point in our transformation year with a mandate to reenergise the region and ensure our growth plans were achieved. I've worked with some great leaders in my career but can confidently say that none have matched Jose for energy, drive and a focus on making teams successful. Within days of joining the business he had identified the key issues that required attention and then set about addressing them - which resulted in earning trust from his teams and a renewed focus on executing. Jose sets high standards for his teams, but not unreasonably so, with an objective of getting the best out of people and helping them to develop. I definitely developed my own skillsets and capabilities under his leadership and am without doubt better equipped to run my own teams as a result. With his focus on speed of execution, the culture was fast paced, a lot of fun, and a can-do attitude prevailed. On a personal level, we developed a great friendship over the time we worked together - he's a family man and he takes the time to get to know his teams personally. One day, I look forward to working for, or with him, again.‚Äù

recommendations: Gwynn Nilo, RPm, SHRM-SCP, CLDP ‚ÄúJames is the most wonderful mentor you could ever ask for - especially if you are seeking mentorship in the area of brand storytelling. recommendations: Lindsay Kelly ‚ÄúVIvien's is a complete natual when it comes to supporting and training others to better themselves. At the empowement workshop she walked us through her personal journey of growth and learning, and then gave us the tools and supported us in practice to become more confident and better public speakers. The combination of demonstration and break out practice sessions helped everybody in the room to grow, and Vivien supported everybody personally, one by one, by watching us try out the new techniques she'd taught us, and providing us live helpful, supportive feedback for us to try out straight away. Vivien is kind, friendly and easily approchable which makes her ideal for this kind of training, and it put us all at ease. Also watching how confident and capable she is at presenting gave us a live view into "how it's done" by a professional. I cannot recommend Vivien or this course enough, and can't wait to see her grow this area over the coming days, weeks, months and years.‚Äù

recommendations: Barbara Kline ‚ÄúKathleen worked for me at both Breakthru Communications and BWise (where I was VP of Marketing). She is thorough, creative, conscientious, and was easily able to manage mutlinational marketing assignments. I have the utmost respect for Kathleen and know that she will be outstanding in anything she undertakes.‚Äù

Scott S. ‚ÄúContent at SAPPHIRE NOW is the reason to attend, must be relevant to the target audiences, and directly impacts the business results. "Global Content Strategy Lead" fails to do justice to the true challenge Kathleen faced, or the accomplishments achieved. It can be hard to put into words how someone performed when their actions have actually set the standard to which you are comparing. Kathleen is not "better than", "stronger than", or "like other in that ...", she IS the standard for content management at the SAPPHIRE NOW programs. But why? Kathleen brought pose, intelligence, coordination, understanding, sympathy, political awareness, product knowledge, consensus building, objective based decisions, and an open ear to the process of leading a cross organizational team, each with their own areas of focus. And, she repeated this for several SAPPHIRE NOW events in different regions. In addition to the process management, she showed the business awareness of how the content would fit into the balance of the event, other marketing activities, and the corporate objectives. To all, she became invaluable and irreplaceable.‚Äù

detailed_profile.name: Jen Moyse
recommendations: Steve Kurzman ‚ÄúJen is not only an extremely effective leader, she‚Äôs a force of nature. I had the pleasure of working with her at TripIt, including as a direct report, and a few things stood out. She built a culture of trust and collaboration within the Product teams ‚Äî and with Engineering ‚Äî based on user-centeredness. ‚ÄúTripiteers‚Äù were really devoted to making travel less stressful for our users. Sometimes we disagreed about how exactly to do that, but we were always willing to work together to solve problems for those users. This enabled our teams to listen to everyone, work well together and accomplish a tremendous amount despite frequently being understaffed and stretched thin. Jen is also adept at translating high-level executive goals from the usual gobbledegook into terms meaningful to individual contributors. Sadly, a rare skill. Her ability to clearly communicate high-level strategy to us meant we were well aligned and empowered to work quickly and independently with a shared vision. Jen got us on the same page and we got stuff done. Finally, Jen actually listens to her reports and invites everyone to speak up, contribute ideas and offer constructive critique. I always felt this had a multiplier effect: if your manager values your input, you tend to care more and follow their lead, which resulted in a strong culture at TripIt. I would happily work for her again.‚Äù

Dave Navarro McDonald ‚ÄúFirst, everybody should be so lucky to work with Jen. She not only is an amazing product professional, but she is a stellar people manager. She enables people to do their best work. I was lucky to work for her while on the TripIt UX team. She is not a designer by trade, but that doesn't make her any less impactful as a UX leader. Jen is able to get consensus in a room full of opinionated designers. That's not an easy task. One of her greatest strengths is getting a diverse group of people together to get things done! Jen is one of the smartest, most insightful people I know. I'm always impressed with her ability to take in complex information and pose thoughtful, curious questions to get to the heart of an issue. She is discerning in her approach to everything that she does. This makes her the sharpest person in the room. You always want to know what Jen thinks about a topic. Trust me. My time working for Jen was the best experience. She leveled up my idea of what a people manager should be. I learned so much from her, and treasure our 1:1s where we talked about work, strategy, and any fun stories we had. I know I'll have made the right career choices if I get to work for Jen again in the future. I'm looking forward to it.‚Äù

publications.title: Large Process Models: A Vision for Business Process Management in the Age of Generative AI
publications.subtitle: KI - K√ºnstliche Intelligenz
publications.description: The continued success of Large Language Models (LLMs) and other generative artificial intelligence approaches highlights the advantages that large information corpora can have over rigidly defined symbolic models, but also serves as a proof-point of the challenges that purely statistics-based approaches have in terms of safety and trustworthiness. As a framework for contextualizing the potential, as well as the limitations of LLMs and other foundation model-based technologies, we propose the concept of a Large Process Model (LPM) that combines the correlation power of LLMs with the analytical precision and reliability of knowledge-based systems and automated reasoning approaches. LPMs are envisioned to directly utilize the wealth of process management experience that experts have accumulated, as well as process performance data of organizations with diverse characteristics, e.g., regarding size, region, or industry. In this vision, the proposed LPM would enable organizations to receive context-specific (tailored) process and other business models, analytical deep-dives, and improvement recommendations. As such, it would allow to substantially decrease the time and effort required for business transformation, while also allowing for deeper, more impactful, and more actionable insights than previously possible. We argue that implementing an LPM is feasible, but also highlight limitations and research challenges that need to be solved to implement particular aspects of the LPM vision.

experience.title: SVP, Head of Digital Business Services, North America
experience.description: As the head of the $1.2b Digital Business Services (DBS) organization in North America, I led all service delivery, implementations, professional services and premium engagement (MaxAttention, ActiveAttention, Value Assurance) services for all SAP S/4 HANA, Success Factors, and Innovative Business Services for SAP customers. SAP DBS typically gets involved in larger, more complex, or strategic engagements for SAP's largest customers for cloud and on-premise implementations. For our most strategic customers, I frequently participated in Steering Committees to ensure the health and success of their deployments.

TSIA Advisory Boards work together to advise on how best to provide TSIA members with the right solutions, programs, research, and events that can help strengthen their businesses.

experience.title: Executive Vice President, Global Vertical Head
experience.description: HCL is a $6.5 billion dollar, global, IT Consulting and Outsourcing company. HCL acquired Axon in December 2008.I enjoyed several successful roles in HCL, but the primary role has been as one of the 5 Global Vertical Heads which manage the P&L across multiple service lines. In the latest role, I managed the services portfolio across the Oil & Gas, Utilities, Travel Transportation and Logistics, and Aerospace and Defense industries for HCL. I managed an overall business portfolio of about $550m in annual revenues with annual growth rates exceeding 20% year-over-year. The primary services business for this portfolio was large, complex services integration programs and we successfully introduced new HCL services (Application Management, Infrastructure, Business Services-BPO, and Engineering Services) into Axon's legacy customers to dramatically increased HCL's market position in these industries.
experience.description_html:
HCL is a $6.5 billion dollar, global, IT Consulting and Outsourcing company. HCL acquired Axon in December 2008.

I enjoyed several successful roles in HCL, but the primary role has been as one of the 5 Global Vertical Heads which manage the P&L across multiple service lines. In the latest role, I managed the services portfolio across the Oil & Gas, Utilities, Travel Transportation and Logistics, and Aerospace and Defense industries for HCL. I managed an overall business portfolio of about $550m in annual revenues with annual growth rates exceeding 20% year-over-year. The primary services business for this portfolio was large, complex services integration programs and we successfully introduced new HCL services (Application Management, Infrastructure, Business Services-BPO, and Engineering Services) into Axon's legacy customers to dramatically increased HCL's market position in these industries.

experience.title: Executive Vice President, North American Sales (various roles)
experience.description: Axon specialized in benefits-led (ROI focused) SAP implementations. After being acquired by Axon, I played a role in the exponential growth of Axon Solutions in North America. While at Axon I performed in various roles, including:* Head of Strategic Industries- I led the go-to-market efforts to ensure our success and growth into key industries including Aerospace & Defense, Utilities, Oil & Gas, Transportation, and Public Sector.* Head of Big Bids and Strategic Engagements- To ensure we successfully targeted and won a significant percentage of the large bids we pursued, I led the team that would bring all the company's best resources and mindshare to these important pursuits. This team won greater than 50% of its pursuits. From there I managed the team responsible for the successful business outcomes of those engagements.* Global Head of Sales Operations and Marketing* Member of Global Operations BoardAxon Solutions was acquired by HCL in 2008.
experience.description_html:
Axon specialized in benefits-led (ROI focused) SAP implementations.

After being acquired by Axon, I played a role in the exponential growth of Axon Solutions in North America. While at Axon I performed in various roles, including:

* Head of Strategic Industries- I led the go-to-market efforts to ensure our success and growth into key industries including Aerospace & Defense, Utilities, Oil & Gas, Transportation, and Public Sector.
* Head of Big Bids and Strategic Engagements- To ensure we successfully targeted and won a significant percentage of the large bids we pursued, I led the team that would bring all the company's best resources and mindshare to these important pursuits. This team won greater than 50% of its pursuits. From there I managed the team responsible for the successful business outcomes of those engagements.
* Global Head of Sales Operations and Marketing
* Member of Global Operations Board

Axon Solutions was acquired by HCL in 2008.

experience.title: EVP, Sales & Business Development
experience.description: TUI was a mid-sized, SAP consulting firm specialized in the Utilities and Public Sector industries.TUI had recently relocated its headquarters to North America and I took over our Marketing, Sales and Business Development efforts. We successfully captured a wedge market position in North America by winning and delivering many fixed price engagements previously only delivered by the larger "Big 5' firms. With this new exposure and market position, several Systems Integration firms became interested in acquiring TUI. I led those discussions and negotiations and eventually were acquired by the UK-based Axon Solutions.
experience.description_html:
TUI was a mid-sized, SAP consulting firm specialized in the Utilities and Public Sector industries.

TUI had recently relocated its headquarters to North America and I took over our Marketing, Sales and Business Development efforts. We successfully captured a wedge market position in North America by winning and delivering many fixed price engagements previously only delivered by the larger "Big 5' firms. With this new exposure and market position, several Systems Integration firms became interested in acquiring TUI. I led those discussions and negotiations and eventually were acquired by the UK-based Axon Solutions.

experience.title: Vice President (various roles)
experience.description: ea was a small consulting firm with a good IT Consulting business. Initially I joined the firm to head overall sales with a primary focus to establish and grow the SAP and ERP Consulting practice. Within the first 2 years, we successfully navigated the practice beyond staff augmentation and into managing new projects ourselves. In this role I led the efforts in developing the practice around Business Process Re-engineering, pre-configured industry solutions, and rapid implementations across many industries including: Manufacturing , High Tech, Consumer Services (CPG), Utilities and Government. Upon substantially growing that area of the business, I subsequently led our efforts in several additional roles including: * VP, Professional Services where I led the delivery of our SAP Practice* VP, Application Hosting where I led the creation of an ASP focusing on industry-focused offerings around SAP and CRM solutions delivered in a subscription-based (SaaS) model

basic_info.search_snippet: Industry Business Unit Head @ SAP | Professional Services, Construction, Travel, & Transportation ¬∑ My team and I set SAP's strategy for a group of ...

detailed_profile.name: Johnny Clemmons, LEED AP
detailed_profile.position: Industry Business Unit Head @ SAP | Professional Services, Construction, Travel, & Transportation
detailed_profile.about: My team and I set SAP's strategy for a group of industries we call Professional Services, Construction, Travel, & Transportation. To do that, we work with our customers to understand where the industry needs to improve. Then we analyze the overall SAP portfolio of solutions to find the ones that best serve those needs. Where solutions don't exist or don't fit the industry need, we work with our internal development team and partners to enhance existing solutions or to develop new solutions on our Business Technology Platform. I believe that, in the industries my team supports, we can literally build a better, more sustainable world and I want to help make that a reality. My approach is informed by my extensive experience in the industry. I've worked as a President, District Manager, Program Manager, Senior Project Manager, Project Manager and Project Engineer in the commercial construction and real estate sectors. In my free time I still enjoy getting my hands dirty with construction projects. A few years ago; my brother-in-law, my daughter, and I built a house for my daughter and her family. With the exception of a few trades that we don't enjoy (concrete, brick, & roofing) we did all the work ourselves.

recommendations: Marc Villeneuve ‚ÄúDan is one of the most tenacious and dedicated people I know. As a direct leader, and now a mentor, he continues to be incredibly supportive and obsessive in helping others grow and succeed. He is always willing to lend a hand, give an opinion, or edit an email or job application. As a salesperson, I have not met anyone as hard-working, compassionate or relentless as Dan. He taught me the value of doing deep research, understanding your product and value inside-out, and being prepared at all times. I could not have asked for someone better to start my sales career with and, like it or not, will continue to lean on Dan as I progress through my own career.‚Äù

Dan Petz ‚ÄúIt's hard to sum up the impact Dan has had on my early sales career in just a few sentences. When I first started Dan worked closely with me through thick and thin to develop my skills and became a major factor in my success. His leadership qualities are exceptional, his emotional intelligence is unmatched and his potential is limitless. He was the kind of guy you could go to with any question or problem, whether it be work-related or in your personal life, he was always there. Dan is also extremely intelligent and competent and brought value to every situation - if he didn't have a solution, he went out and found one. Not many are lucky enough to have had such a great boss, one who genuinely makes you excited to come to work every day and proud to work for. Even after leaving our team, Dan will be someone I turn to for advice and I look forward to remaining close in the years to come. Thank you for all that you've done Dan, I really appreciate it man. Always remember to name your price!‚Äù

recommendations: Ian Chamberland ‚ÄúI was lucky enough to work with Spencer at IntelyCare for a little over a year and I can say with confidence he is one of the best people I have ever had the privilege of working with. Spencer has an unparalleled ability to connect with people, from the building maintenance staff all the way up the C-Suite. He is able to communicate "at their level" and can adjust his communication tactics to meet the audience where they are. Not once did I ever hear "won't" or "can't" - no matter the problem, Spencer will do whatever it takes to find a solution that works for all parties involved and won't stop until he finds it. Adept at leveraging the different tools and resources available to him, I can't count the number of innovative solutions he came up with that helped IntelyCare capitalize on new opportunities, improve KPIs, or just "be there" for someone when they needed a pick-me up. Spencer is the kind of person you want to work with day in and day out. Between his quantitative skills, his natural selling skills, and ability to connect with people, anyone lucky enough to be in Spencer's orbit stands to be a better person after having known him. I'm incredibly thankful for everything he did at IntelyCare - if you're lucky enough to have him on your team, you won't be disappointed.‚Äù

Jeff Hymas ‚ÄúI can't say enough good things about the job Spencer did as our summer marketing intern at Savage. From his positive attitude, dedicated work ethic, and always going above and beyond what was asked, we were very fortunate to have Spencer as a part of our team. He made a big difference in a short amount of time, helping us with projects in website SEO, new office openings, market research, and much more. Spencer would be a fantastic addition to any team that's looking to grow and wants to hire someone who will contribute to a positive company culture and help achieve business success. ‚Äù

publications.title: New Data Imperative: Managing Real-Time Risk in Capital Markets
publications.subtitle: Easton Studio Press
publications.description: When historians look back on the years 2007 to 2009, they will call this period "The Age of Risk Negligence." Major capital market firms had smart systems in place through which market data flowed and it was all managed by smart men and women who oversaw their firm's risk exposure. Despite these sober systems, the source of the global financial breakdown was not in the risk technology or the people in charge of the systems, but in the people who ignored the warnings. Risk practices went out the window as firms chased profits with reckless abandon.How do we avoid this risk calamity in the future? The New Data Imperative: Managing Real-Time Risk in Capital Markets is a start. Written by Dr. Raj Nathan, Irfan Khan and Sinan Baskan, this book is a clear-eyed roadmap for building a reinforced data enterprise that will help fortify today's ambitious investment firms.

detailed_profile.about: SUMMARY Senior Leader with 25 years of experience in leading the teams delivering engineering excellence, customer commitments and business transformations. In the vast experience I have worn multiple hats from developer, architectural designer to global Senior Leadership role. I have also explored the path of being an entrepreneur, co-founding a startup as Chief Technology Officer. My expertise spans the entire lifecycle of portfolio development, from ideation and business case creation to execution at scale. Currently heads the global teams of SCM core, public cloud Operational Manufacturing unit delivering world class solutions enabling our customers to ‚Äòplan‚Äô, ‚Äòcommit‚Äô ‚Äòproduce‚Äô and 'maintain'. In my previous role at SAP, I was responsible for global development unit (750+) of SAP S/4 HANA Project Management and Cross Industry Engineering organization with teams across the globe (India, Germany, Budapest, France, China, Serbia, and USA). In this role I manage a diverse portfolio of topics ranging from various industries like discrete industries, automotive, oil & gas, mill & mining, professional services, and health care to critical foundational topics that run across SAP solutions of master data, document management services and content management. Along with the business unit responsibilities, I have also played the role, as the chairperson for Respect at Work internal compliance committee at SAP, responsible for ensuring an environment that is free from harassment, discrimination and retaliations at our workplaces for all SAP entities in India.

recommendations: Andres Botero ‚ÄúFor many years I worked with Richard at SAP and for a couple of years I reported directly to him. Overall we worked together for about 10 years. Richard is one of the most knowledgeable people around in the Supply Chain Management space, period. He has a lot of domain expertise and is able to quickly assess the strategic and tactical implications of new developments in the space. Richard is a fantastic communicator and one of the sharpest pens I have ran across. His blog series and tweets have made him into a powerful influencer in the enterprise SCM area. He is a no non-sense manager and has a fantastic sense of humor. He is able to easily build bridges to Analysts and other key influencers as his approachable and demeanor makes it impossible not to like him. As a manager Richard inspired me to give my best to the company and the role. He removed obstacles blocking my pathway, he supported me when I needed it, he encourage me and push me when it made sense. The years I reported to Richard were very productive and fulfilling for me in great part because of his hands-on, trusting style and his constant coaching and advise. Richard's teams have always been recognized as high performing and their impact has gone well beyond its size. Richard is a go- getter and highly productive. Either working on a tele campaign, collateral, analyst interaction, blog, analysis or keynote presentation, every minute invested with him advanced the project and got us close to our goal. SAP is lucky to have Richard in its ranks as his productivity and impact in SCM are huge. And I am grateful for the opportunity to work with and for him and learning a lot in the process.‚Äù

Colin Masson ‚ÄúIt was a pleasure to work with Richard during my tenure at Marcam and Invensys. Having 'done his time' in product development, project implementation and the product management of ERP for the process industries, Richard was well respected by both his subordinates and his peers. Richard brings energy, enthusiasm, credibility and executable vision to any Marketing team. His people management skills, and presentation skills are also worthy of a special mention.‚Äù

publications.title: The Ultimate Guide To Running A Live Supply Chain
publications.subtitle: Supply Chain World
publications.description: The digital economy is radically transforming supply chain. Technological innovations are leading to more complex products. Individualization and accelerated delivery schedules are leading to rising customer expectations.Today‚Äôs supply chain organizations must respond to these challenges by gaining greater agility, visibility, and scalability. The key to achieving this hinges on transforming your traditional supply chain into a digitized, extended supply chain.

publications.title: Trading Places: United States As The New China?
publications.subtitle: Forbes
publications.description: We‚Äôre all familiar with the reasons why the U.S. outsources large parts of its manufacturing resources overseas. But the surprising results from two recent reports suggest the global supply chain game is about to get turned upside down. Will businesses be ready?

publications.title: When It Comes To Changing The World, Millennials Mean Business
publications.subtitle: www.forbes.com
publications.description: My children, and their (virtual) ‚Äúfriends,‚Äù are driving demand and changing the game for businesses today, literally ‚Äúchanging the world.‚Äù They don‚Äôt, and never will, read newspapers. They fast forward through ads on TV. They spend hours huddled over the font of all knowledge ‚Äì the smart phone ‚Äì even when in the same room as their friends! They would rather communicate using text messages, Instagram or Twitter than (God forbid) pick up the phone and talk in person. And when they do talk face-to-face, it is usually via Skype or Facetime.......

publications.title: Horses For (Main) Courses!
publications.subtitle: www.forbes.com
publications.description: The Horsemeat scandal running wild across Europe didn‚Äôt exactly break out of the starting gate. It began at a canter in January, when the Food Safety Authority of Ireland found isolated cases of horsemeat in beef burgers sold in British and Irish supermarkets.The story gained global attention, picking up its pace to a full gallop, in mid-February when European food regulators discovered horsemeat in school meals and hospitals across Europe and the U.K. Major supermarkets.How can we protect the Supply Chain through improved traceability?

publications.title: Fourth Place At The Olympics Is The Loneliest Place In The World
publications.subtitle: www.forbes.com
publications.description: As a child in the UK, I grew up watching British athletes become the also-rans of Olympic finals. We celebrated ‚Äújust being there‚Äù where ‚Äúmaking the podium‚Äù was victory and ‚Äúbronze was the new gold.‚Äù The Olympic Games brings with them the opportunity of substantial income and the potential to generate considerable publicity (good and bad) for suppliers of goods and services at all stages in the supply chain. It has been estimated that around ¬£5 billion worth of Olympic Games related contracts have already been won.Be ready. There is no lonelier place than fourth place in the Olympics. Companies and the athletes need to run like never before.

publications.title: The Perfect Storm is Forming for Sales and Operations Planning
publications.subtitle: www.forbes.com
publications.description: A ‚Äúperfect storm‚Äù describes an event when a rare combination of circumstances aggravate a situation drastically. We are seeing a simular convergence of events in the S&OP processes in business today. We need to effectively manage and leverage the big data volumes now available from structured and unstructured sources. We are also seeing the need for increased collaboration across these global networks and the need for speed in sensing, analyzing, simulating and profitably responding to the business dynamics. And at the eye of the proverbial storm: Global Supply Chains and the Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) processes that drive them.

publications.title: 2012 Supply Chain Predictions: Is the End of the World Nigh?
publications.subtitle: www.forbes.com
publications.description: It‚Äôs that time, once again, when everyone predicts what will happen in the coming year. But 2012 is an extra-special year; it carries heavy historical baggage chock full of dire predictions. Nostradamus painted a bleak picture of massive destruction and mayhem brought about by a comet in 2012. The Mayans take it one step further since they simply stopped their calendar on December 21st signaling the end of the world. Gulp!

publications.title: The Secrets of Santas Supply Chain
publications.subtitle: Forbes.com
publications.description: Gartner likes to publish the Top 25 Supply Chains every year. Unfortunately, there‚Äôs one supply chain the esteemed analyst firm continues to overlook. And it just so happens to be the greatest supply chain success story of all time. I‚Äôm talking about The Santa Claus Supply Chain. Don‚Äôt believe me? Who else can claim:‚Ä¢A laser focus on the target market ‚Äì Children of all ages‚Ä¢100% perfect order rating, on-time delivery and fill rates‚Ä¢A global distribution channel that spans the world in 24 hours‚Ä¢Direct Door to Chimney Delivery Model‚Ä¢A committed workforce with zero turnover‚Ä¢The very first known supply chain to run ‚Äúin the cloud‚Äù

publications.title: Are you ready for the "Social" supply chain
publications.subtitle: www.forbes.com
publications.description: How will social networking affect businesses and supply chains? We are seeing a lot of marketing to end consumers, and thus new channels to drive demand, but how can we improve our supply processes? Can we leverage social networks to drive benefits across our end-to-end supply chain processes?

publications.title: Why Good Products Fail and What You Can Do About It
publications.subtitle: www.forbes.com
publications.description: The business world is littered with examples of good ideas that have been poorly executed or simply in the wrong place at the wrong time. The recent Global Supply Chain Trends survey by PRTM Management Consultants talked about ‚Äútearing down the walls‚Äù between supply chain management and product development/engineering‚Äù, a critical enabler for accelerating ramp-up and ramp-down of products into diverse customer markets. Half of those surveyed understand this and consequently have invested in higher development responsiveness. A ‚Äúwin-win‚Äù collaborative set-up includes joint consideration of product development, sales and supply chain requirements.

recommendations: Mike O'Neil ‚ÄúAs an SAP Partner Sales Manager who reported to me, Beth displayed all the qualities you look for in a sales professional. She is an assertive, well-organized leader who pushes her partners to excel and exceed their go-to-market objectives. As a senior professional on the team, Beth shared her best practices and acted as a mentor to the group. She consistently surpassed her sales objectives and was recognized by both SAP peers and the broader partner community as a problem solver who removed roadblocks and obstacles to success. Beth displays excellent communication skills and is very persuasive. I highly recommend Beth as a senior partner sales professional.‚Äù

LinkedIn User ‚ÄúI wish Beth was on my team right now. I spent 5 years on the same team with Beth at SAP where together with Shane Corr, we managed the SAP Business One Channel in the United States. Working on the same team with Beth was one of the best experiences of my career. When I was on Beth's team, she consistently blew away her quota every quarter..... I personally watched that happen for 5 years straight. Since Beth is extremely competitive, it drove the rest of the team to also overachieve. Beth built a solid business in her region that continues to grow in many ways. Beth is passionate about the success of her business, and more importantly the success of her partners and her teammates. The comradery that our team had would be hard to replicate. On top of it all, our team had a lot of fun together and I built a great friendship with Beth. If I could build a team of the best people I have ever worked with, Beth would be on it.‚Äù

detailed_profile.name: Babu Tammisetti
recommendations: ‚ÄúIn my opinion Babu has one of the most difficult jobs in the development organizations - he manages the Query Optimizer. The main difficulty comes from the fact that any change in the optimizer will make some queries faster while others slower. This is the fact of life the Optimizer group has to live with. I think Babu has a great talent in selecting the right set of fixes and projects making the Optimizer better and keeping the customers happy. Babu has a rare skill of dealing with customers. He does not blindly submit to every customers' desire without making sure that it will be inline with the group's vision, yet can still be very crafty in making them happy with possibly an alternative solution. Babu is not only a great manager but he is also an excellent engineer. He knows the code and the architecture like no one else. There isn't a single project that completes without his input. One of the best experiences for me working in Babu's group was a special team spirit that he created and maintained. It is not very obvious to the people outside of the group and it is not something people inside will talk about, but when you are in you know that you have the support of your piers trying to achieve the same goal for the best interest of the Optimizer component. On the personal side Babu is a very pleasant person. Working with him was very easy for me from day one. I felt like I have known him for years. Hopefully one day our roads will cross again and we'll get to work on the same project. I had a lot fun working in the Optimizer group in large due to the atmosphere created by Babu.‚Äù Show less

patents.title: AUTOMATIC CONFIGURATION OF A COMPUTER SYSTEM BASED ON PROCESS MODELING OF AN IMPLEMENTED PROCESS
patents.description: A configuration architecture automatically links the output of a business process modeler to a business system configuration tool. The output of the business process modeler is translated into a representation of a source business process that is used by the business system configuration tool to automatically generate configuration templates. A user can provide configuration information through the configuration templates. The configuration inputs are applied to an implementation of a business system to obtain a configured, working business system instance with the same functionality as the source business process.

patents.title: APPLICATION CONFIGURATION FRAMEWORK FOR ENTERPRISE RESOURCE PLANNING APPLICATION INSTALLATION
patents.description: A configuration application utilizes an application configuration framework to create a configuration questionnaire to dynamically manage an enterprise resource planning (ERP) application installation process. The configuration application imports an ERP system's metadata to configure the ERP application installation through the application configuration framework. The configuration application requests question parameters from a configuring user to configure the ERP application installation according to the metadata. Subsequently, the configuration application creates a configuration questionnaire for the ERP application installation based on the question parameters.

patents.title: ACCOUNTING FOR CONTRACT FORMATION AND FULFILLMENT ACTIVITIES
patents.description: Technologies are generally described for accounting for contract formation and fulfillment activities by combination event chaining and multidimensional measurement chaining, with event and measurement matching rules that apply variance and tolerance policies during evaluation. Building on chaining basis and derived measurements that participate in an equality relationship, chaining measurements may participate in a matching rule that applies tolerance policies. Furthermore, measurement chaining may be updated when the documented consequence of events are corrected or changed.

patents.title: APPLICATION PROCESS FRAMEWORK FOR INTEGRATED AND EXTENSIBLE ACCOUNTING SYSTEM
patents.description: Technologies are generally described for a consistent process, task, and state application architecture pattern from an initial documentation process through the resource accounting, subledger accounting processes, and the general ledger accounting process. Data driven policy and rules may be leveraged for the processing to determine input, results, and state transitioning, where processes may represent operations performed by the accounting system. The application process pattern may be an abstraction of key domain processes and their generic tasks and states. The framework tasks may leverage explicit policy and rule types and/or procedures to determine a result and to validate the state transition.

patents.title: MULTIDIMENSIONAL MEASUREMENT BASIS FOR ACCOUNTING SYSTEMS
patents.description: Techniques to provide a multi-measurement basis for accounting systems are described. A technique may include receiving data from a source document, documenting the received data as base multidimensional measurements that characterize an event, calculating derived multidimensional measurements that quantify the social, operational, and financial consequences of the event from the base multidimensional measurements. Derived measurements are linked to base measurements in measurement chains. Events that are related causally may be linked together in event chains. The measurement chains and event chains may be used to generate subledger journal entries, which may in turn be used to generate general ledger journal entries. An event may capture information about an event beyond what may be reflected in the source document. Other embodiments are described and claimed.

detailed_profile.about: Everything revolves around ‚Äòempathy‚Äô and so has the roles I have played so far in the last 2 decades across two continents- be it in the banking industry or software, across roles in sales, customer service, product and team management. I am currently engaged in weaving the product strategy for Cloud ERP. Bringing a 360-degree perspective to the product, building it into the strategy and steering strategic projects, communicating the strategy in a simple and bi-directional manner and guiding it to a meaningful execution with our dear customers and partners, enabling cross-organizational teams across sales, marketing and Product Management, my day is an E2E vista of the product and its value from strategy to execution. With great enthusiasm for everything around end-to-end product management and novel training concepts, I am on a journey of discovering the subtle nuances in product management, adding the flavor of ‚Äòempathy‚Äô and ‚Äòemotional intelligence‚Äô to every single aspect and stage of the product. Every product, process or project indeed revolves around ‚Äòpeople‚Äô and every product innovation and leadership should emanate that value. In parallel, I am a creative writer, choreographer and trainer in performing arts experimenting new concepts in dance as a therapy.

positions.subtitle: SAP
positions.description: Strategy is a culture that seeps into the organization through inspiring discussions and my mantra for product leadership is continuous exchange with diverse personas in the organization to encapsulate innovative ideas and bring strategy to life. With dedicated focus on strategy, I enjoy interacting with the teams across board areas and empowering them with 360-degree product insights and the 'why' behind what we build. Accompanying customers and partners in their digital transformation journey with a value-driven product strategy and bringing back their feedback to product teams and SAP as a whole. Steering strategic projects and global enablement. Been the SPoC for the product-specific information as part of the SAP Digital Discovery Assessment with a view from strategy to execution and building the feedback into the product strategy. Deciphering and driving innovation topics of today and the future of ERP. Cloud ERP evangelist, emphasizing on value and empathy in every single touch point in the product journey working with teams across SAP, our dear customers and partners and the entire SAP Community. Speaker, mentor, SAP Catalyst, Change ambassador and a Product Management Coach with a large appetite for learning. Title change in April 2025.Relocation to India in August 2023 working with a global ecosystem of customers, partners and SAP enthusiasts. Nasscom Mentor since November 2024.

recommendations: Doug Eisengrein, CLSS ‚ÄúI was interviewed and hired, and then directly managed by Lori for about 6 months in 2009 at Unisfair, a small Silicon Valley SaaS startup. During that period, I experienced on a daily basis Lori's adept management skill and technical acumen, as well as her direct-but-friendly professional demeanor. Her ability to lead a diverse Operations team in a highly technical, fast-changing environment - particularly during extremely busy times with non-negotiable client deadlines - was a master class in efficient project execution, professionalism, and employee support. Right in the middle of the company's busiest quarter, I had an unexpected family emergency - and Lori's support was unwavering. Upon returning to the office a few weeks later, I saw and heard how my substantial workload was rapidly re-assigned and load-balanced, keeping mission-critical client services moving straight ahead. I would gladly recommend Lori for her senior technical management aptitude, as well as her warm yet "firm when it matters" personality.‚Äù

Kara Shields ‚ÄúI was extremely lucky to work with Lori as a consultant on one of her projects. Lori is easily one of the most organized and driven project managers I've worked with but has no trouble bending her style to accommodate even the pickiest of customers. Her clients were consistently impressed by her prep work as well as the way she ran implementations in a fun and effective way. As a consultant working with Lori, she was great about checking in to see if I needed support on my tasks, but was also happy to step back and let me handle things when my expertise was needed. I was very grateful for her balance of management and trust. Lori would be an asset to any team! ‚Äù

experience.description_html:
I served as the Sales Manager for MSM Funding Corp., a mortgage financial solutions company located in Columbia, MD. I assisted in managing all aspects of sales operations including financial performance, inside/outside sales, marketing, loan modifications and employee development/retention. I led a team of 15 loan officers, 2 team leaders and an administrative staff. Identified core competencies in the interview process and made final decisions on hiring applicants.
• Constructed and managed a sales team to $15M in monthly sales volume
• Personally closed $2M in volume each month in addition to managing the sales force
• Generated new business-to-business relationships with local real estate agents, attorneys, financial advisors and title companies to create a sales flow pipeline
• Was also responsible for recruiting plans, talent evaluation and sales training
• Managed and directed sales staff to over 1350 loans and over $405M in volume over tenure

recommendations: LinkedIn User ‚ÄúChris was my peer for several years and then he became my boss. He is thoughtful, courteous, and was easy to work with to accomplish tasks with together as a peer. When he became my boss, our relationship continued to grow and he became a mentor for me. I always knew he would provide advice when given and it was usually a different lens than my own. I appreciated his openness and honesty and trustworthiness. I always knew if I asked a hard question, he would tell me the truth and give me constructive feedback. I sought out Chris when I wanted to return to the workforce and he hired me back. He provided me challenging roles and promoted me to leading the operations center. He always provided great mentorship and a friend as well. ‚Äù

LinkedIn User ‚ÄúI had opportunities to work with Chris in 3 different teams within Microsoft, in different roles over the course of last 8-10 years. And every time, it has been a great learning experience. I have seen him evolve and grow and take greater responsibilities and excel in the same. As a leader, he has always been structured, consistent, composed, very detail oriented yet empowering his team members, open to suggestions and feedback. Chris consistently put the org's, partner's and team's goals on priority and is an awesome partner to work with. He is a great mix of technical acumen, process and project management, people skills and business strategic thinking. I have learnt a lot by just observing him, by my direct and indirect interactions with him and by his mentoring and guidance. He is someone, who is a great asset, an awesome leader and trusted advisor for any organization and team. ‚Äù

basic_info.name: April Perkins - Senior Manager, SAP Center of Excellence
basic_info.search_snippet: Senior Manager, SAP Center of Excellence ¬∑ If I had to choose one phrase to describe my professional career it would be twist of fate; an unanticipated ...

detailed_profile.name: April Perkins
detailed_profile.position: Senior Manager, SAP Center of Excellence
detailed_profile.about: If I had to choose one phrase to describe my professional career it would be twist of fate; an unanticipated change in a sequence of events. I was supposed to be a mechanical engineer and I loved everything about the prospects of this career path! The math, the problem solving, the technology and most importantly‚Ä¶the cars (because I am a total gearhead). A twist of fate (and a need to fund my college tuition) brought me to the metals industry. This was supposed to be a quick pit stop on the road to my engineering destiny. Then two years later 9/11 happened and no one was hiring engineers. Well then, metals industry I guess I am here to stay! Fast forward six years and another twist of fate opened up a door to a role in IT. A very unlikely choice for me personally but the prospect of trying something new and unknown was very attractive at the time. Fast forward sixteen more years and I cannot imagine not being in IT. Participating in seven SAP ECC implementations for 1,800 users, traveling the world to collaborate with colleagues and solving complex problems daily pretty much guarantees no day is like the one before. As my role has evolved to senior leadership I have had the opportunity to build a world class SAP Center of Excellence with my cohort, foster the professional growth of team members and founded a DEI group for women in STEM. I am particularly proud of these DEI groups, as I have had the pleasure of participating in several other local and global women‚Äôs groups and it has been very rewarding to see individuals blossom when supported by others who provide a safe space, recognize potential, understand the challenges you face and believe in you even when you do always not believe in yourself. Seeing others grow to their full potential has been one of the most rewarding experiences in my professional career. Sometimes I do not even know what my actual role is. If you need a beacon of hope, a rock to lean on, to talk to someone who will listen or who sees you as your true self give me a call. Perhaps this is what fate had in store for me all along.

recommendations: Luke Gleadall, MEd ‚ÄúI had the huge pleasure of working with Dave during my time at SAP Concur. During that time, Dave constantly impressed me. There are many talents for me to cover but possibly one of my favorites is his wonderful knack of getting to the heart of the problem through asking the most pertinent questions and doing so with a genuine curiosity. An astute thinker and a visionary, he added incredible value with his insight into many projects. He is gifted with both an eye for detail and a strategic vision that leads small to big projects. Through his work, he has boosted the team and the organization with incredible influence. On top of all this, he builds relationships across the organization easily and is a joy to work with. I am beyond grateful that I had the opportunity to work alongside him and learn from him in so many ways.‚Äù

Laurel Schulert ‚ÄúFor the past 5 years, Dave has been my thought partner in leading the Learning Experience team at SAP Concur. Dave is a visionary thinker, and also brings a keen business acumen and an action-oriented attitude. Dave skilfully led transformative projects for us, such as the rollout of agile project management to our department, and he also played an integral role in defining and launching our new project management tool and project intake process. Dave also partnered with me to co-present sessions at the DevLearn and Association for Talent Development (ATD) conferences, and co-authored a job aid in an ATD publication. Dave has a remarkable ability to bring both "out of the box" thinking and a "can-do" attitude to roll up his sleeves and get things done. Dave is also an all-around great human. He has tremendous empathy and compassion for others, and often came to me to celebrate other team members' accomplishments and to praise others for their contributions to his projects. He looks out for people around him, and ensures everyone is set up for success. Dave enjoyed mentoring and coaching newer members on our team, and people naturally gravitated to him when they were in need of assistance. Dave made an indelible mark on SAP Concur, and any team would be fortunate to have him in their ranks.‚Äù

detailed_profile.about: Thank you for taking the time to learn more about me. I am an experienced business strategist and transformation specialist with a passion for leading global teams. My expertise in analytics, supply chain, and business strategy allows me to help critical industries develop profitable and sustainable networks. I thrive on working with individuals who believe in the importance of adapting and evolving their leadership values. In my previous role as Operations Executive for a Cloud Solutions company and Business Intelligence Practice Lead, I successfully delivered cloud-based solutions for companies throughout Africa. I have also led teams to help companies in key industries including transportation and logistics, consumer goods, pharma, beverage, manufacturing, paper, brewing, packaging, and construction realize value from business transformation. My skills include leadership development and coaching, evangelizing innovation in business, strategic process analysis, project management, full systems development lifecycle, inter and intra-company collaboration activities, training and mentoring, business analysis, and conference speaking. Let's connect and see how I can help transform your team and business.

detailed_profile.name: Mahuya Paul
detailed_profile.position: Kind. Wise. Funny.
detailed_profile.about: When I moved to Bangalore from my small hometown in Assam at the turn of the century, I had no definite plan, just a joie de vivre, confident in the knowledge that life will work out somehow. And it did. Two decades, and a lot of learning later, I am my hero, totally at calm within, and outside. While following the lives of the great ones, and the famous ones, and the rich and fortunate ones, I discovered that the only person I can influence and better, is myself. Yes, a Jeff Bezos or an Elon Musk, or a Rafa Nadal story sounds great, and they inspire me on a daily basis. But that‚Äôs them. I am my own individual with my ideas, and my shortcomings. And it‚Äôs my choice to pick happiness over a position, travel over a foreign education, kindness over proving a point. I grew up the day I realised that I control my happiness, and that happiness comes from the inside. My only aim is to become the best version of myself, and since I have been at it for a long, long, time, the process is effortless!

17 years in one place? I know, shocking. But why leave when I already have everything I ever wanted—great work-life balance, amazing colleagues, and a fantastic manager?

The fancy designations showed up along the way—like surprise bonus points in a game I wasn’t even playing. Now, as Director, not much changes except the title. More responsibilities, yes. But hard work never scared me.

The real win has been finding a workplace that feels like home.

recommendations: Dave C. ‚ÄúI consider myself incredibly lucky to have worked alongside Kate, where I was able to observe as she led and supported her team, and I could not recommend her enough. It's easy to become a manager. Almost anyone can do it. Do your job, show a passing interest in leadership, pull some numbers/metrics, and sit in your seat for a few years. But it is not easy to become a good manager. Kate is a good manager. What makes a good manager? This is a question I've asked myself a lot as someone that, in their entire time at McAfee, has had a total of 8 managers (pretty much one manager per year at this point). I've seen individuals where I can objectively look at them and go "Oh, they are okay" or "Yikes, glad I don't report to them", and in Kate's case, "Dang, that's a good leader". Whenever I try to define for myself how I come to this determination of "what makes a good manager", It aways boils down to the same 3 (totally related) concepts: Supportive, empathetic, mindful. Kate is all of these things and more. I consider it my absolute privilege to have seen Kate stand up for the value of her team time and time again; the quality of their output, the professionalism in their delivery, and the attention to detail they so often provided. A good manager instills that sort of confidence and delivery in the people they lead - and I will state again, for the 3rd time in this recommendation, Kate is that good manager.‚Äù

Michael Labate ‚ÄúKate is a true people leader and a master of her craft. She managed me directly for almost three years, and in that time I felt continuously supported and encouraged. I was always given the independence I needed to succeed in a senior role, but could always trust in her guidance and mentorship whenever I needed it. She fostered a highly collaborative content design team where we all felt comfortable sharing our work and tackling problems together. I learned immensely from her feedback and her strategic, scalable approach to resolving issues of all sorts and sizes. Kate really cares about the people she manages. She sees the potential in others and does everything she can to nurture their growth and help them achieve their goals. I highly recommend her as a content design leader.‚Äù

recommendations: Andrea Carlson ‚ÄúMelissa is a natural leader who makes it look so effortless. I have had the pleasure of working alongside Melissa for over 10 years at SAP and am continually inspired by her dedication to the success of her programs, and most importantly to the success of her team. Planning events can be extremely stressful at times and she has an amazing way of keeping the team encouraged by affirming those around her and offering professional mentorship to those who may need it. She believes in giving back to her team which inspires us all to do the same. She is not intimidated by executive level titles, and is not afraid to make decisions and to stand by them. Seeing her work through that told me everything I needed to know about her mettle and determination. Empathetic, calm and full of integrity, Melissa is someone who I would choose to have on my team 100% of the time.‚Äù

recommendations: Philip Miseldine ‚ÄúJason needs a different kind of recommendation. Typing into a text field cliched superlatives just can't serve justice to the natural, warm fit I feel when working with Jason. How to explain it? Let's try. You know that feeling of finishing that long workshop, still jet lagged, ready for a hotel meal and bed? Jason is the sole reason you can't wait to go out that evening, go to bed late and skip breakfast, because how could you not exchange more ideas, hang out, and learn from him? That's Jason. Or that late evening, timezone dependent call. Set at 7pm...sigh...You wake up, you review your calendar, see that late night meeting...that's the meeting you look forward to most just because it's with Jason. He'll inspire you, entertain you, and you know for sure something special will come out of it. His expertise and creativity in analytics, the technology sector, and its application to defence leaves you with a head full of ideas. Without doubt, if you need an explosively innovative mindset, bursting at the seams with ideas, passion, and creativity, Jason has you covered. If you also need a kind, considered, thoughtful innovator on top? Jason has both in spades. He's a uniquely talent person, and someone I always look towards for inspiration, and that rock n roll spirit in software innovation.‚Äù

Tony Strickland ‚ÄúI had the privilege of working with Jason Shearer from 2015-2017 while we established the foundations for a Continuous Improvement program at the Salt Lake City site for L3 Technologies. With his expertise in architecting and constructing database systems and technology infrastructures, we literally put together a technology infrastructure for a population of 3,500 employees - fully functional - in less than 9 months after I joined the company. It was incredible to have multiple moments where I would ask for a new functionality, a design change, or a user-interface update and Jason's response would either be "I have already completed that and am ready to show you" or when I asked to have the modification within two weeks, I would almost always get it within two days. Jason is keenly insightful, strategic-thinking, detail-focused and a delightful person to have drive innovation and change. I fully support any decisions to have him lead, or be a part of, a strategic leadership team for technology and visionary improvements that any organization is looking to implement.‚Äù

organizations.title: Maternal and Child Consortium of Chester County
organizations.description: MCHC‚Äôs mission is to improve maternal and child health through the collaborative efforts of individuals, providers, and policy makers. Through a growing body of research and our own experiences, we know that accomplishing our mission requires us to focus on a child‚Äôs earliest years, including the prenatal period. Working with both mothers and children in these critical early years sets up the entire family for good health and establishes a strong foundation for learning. Yet, many Chester County families who are struggling merely to make ends meet and to provide the basic essentials are not able to focus on their child‚Äôs health and development. Our core programs reach families who are facing such hardships at a critical time in their children‚Äôs lives, removing the barriers that stand in the way of their child‚Äôs health and success.
